greeting: Greetings from The On-Line Encyclopedia of Integer Sequences! http://oeis.org/

results.name: Lexicographically earliest infinite sequence such that a(i) = a(j) => f(i) = f(j), where f(n) = min(n, A057889(n)), and A057889 is a bijective base-2 reverse.
comment: Restricted growth sequence transform of A331166. See comments in that sequence.
link: Antti Karttunen, Table of n, a(n) for n = 0..100000
Index entries for sequences related to binary expansion of n
program: rgs_transform(invec) = { my(om = Map(), outvec = vector(length(invec)), u=1); for(i=1, length(invec), if(mapisdefined(om,invec[i]), my(pp = mapget(om, invec[i])); outvec[i] = outvec[pp] , mapput(om,invec[i],i); outvec[i] = u; u++ )); outvec; };
xref: Cf. also A324400, A331303, A305801, A305801, A305900, A295300 for other "top level" filtering sequences.
results.author: _Antti Karttunen_, Jan 18 2020
